definitions.definition: (heading) A pile.
A smokestack.
(heading) In computing.
A generalization of schemes in algebraic geometry and of sheaves.
A coastal landform, consisting of a large vertical column of rock in the sea.
(library) Compactly spaced bookshelves used to house large collections of books.
A large amount of an object.
definitions.example: They paid him a stack of money to keep quiet.

definitions.definition: A pile of rifles or muskets in a cone shape.
The amount of money a player has on the table.
(heading) In architecture.
A fall or crash, a prang.
A blend of various dietary supplements or anabolic steroids with supposed synergistic benefits.
A holding pattern, with aircraft circling one above the other as they wait to land.
The quantity of a given item which fills up an inventory slot or bag.
definitions.example: I've got 107 Golden Branches, but the stack size is 20 so they're taking up 6 spaces in my inventory.

definitions.definition: To arrange in a stack, or to add to an existing stack.
definitions.example: Please stack those chairs in the corner.

definitions.definition: To arrange the cards in a deck in a particular manner.
definitions.example: This is the third hand in a row where you've drawn four of a kind. Someone is stacking the deck!

definitions.definition: To take all the money another player currently has on the table.
definitions.example: I won Jill's last $100 this hand; I stacked her!

definitions.definition: To deliberately distort the composition of (an assembly, committee, etc.).
definitions.example: The Government was accused of stacking the parliamentary committee.

definitions.definition: To crash; to fall.
definitions.example: Jim couldn′t make it today as he stacked his car on the weekend.

definitions.definition: To operate cumulatively.
definitions.example: A magical widget will double your mojo. And yes, they do stack: if you manage to get two magical widgets, your mojo will be quadrupled. With three, it will be octupled, and so forth.

definitions.definition: To place (aircraft) into a holding pattern.
To collect precious metal in the form of various small objects such as coins and bars.
